de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.core.logic
Class Turn

java.lang.Object
  de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.core.logic.Turn

public class Turn
extends java.lang.Object

This represents a single turn by the current player inside a game/match.

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: Turn.java 805 2010-07-06 01:16:23Z andre.koenig $

Constructor Detail

Turn

public Turn(Player currentPlayer,
            World world,
            java.util.Vector<Player> players,
            java.util.Vector<CountryCard> countryCards,
            java.util.Vector<CountryCard> usedCountryCards,
            CardSeriesCounter seriesCounter)
Constructs a new turn.

Parameters:
currentPlayer - This is the new current player.
world - The world object played on.
players - The player vector inheriting all players to this match.
Vector - countryCards Vector with country card obtainable after a succesful attack.
Vector - usedCountryCards Vector with turned in country cards.
CardSeriesCounter - seriesCounter Counter of turned in series in the game.
Method Detail

createArmies

private void createArmies()
Creates armies for the current player by taking his countryCount / 3. If its less than 3, the current player gets 3 armies.

Parameters:
currentPlayer - The current player of this turn.

createArmies

private void createArmies(int numberOfArmies)
Creates armies by a certain amount.

Parameters:
numberOfArmies - Number of armies to create.

createArmies

private void createArmies(java.lang.Boolean seriesTurnIn)
Creates armies out of a series or just creates beginning armies.

Parameters:
seriesTurnIn - True if a series is turned in.

allocateArmy

public void allocateArmy(Country country)
                  throws NotEnoughArmiesException,
                         CountryOwnerException
Allocates a single allocatable army into a country.

Parameters:
country - The country where to put an army.
Throws:
NotEnoughArmiesException
CountryOwnerException

attack

public AttackResult attack(Country attacker,
                           Country defender,
                           int armyCount)
                    throws CountriesNotInRelationException,
                           NotEnoughArmiesException,
                           IsOwnCountryException
Attacker country attacks defender country and chooses how many armies he uses. Attack result with be formed. If the players wins a country first time in this turn he'll get a country card.

Parameters:
attackerCountry - Country where to attack from.
defenderCountry - Country which will be attacked.
armyCount - Number of armies used. max: 1 <= armies available <= 3 ; min: 1. Minimum one army must remain on the country.
Throws:
CountriesNotInRelationException - The countries are not connected.
IsOwnCountryException - Trying to attack an own country.
NotEnoughArmiesException - Too little or too many armies used.

moveArmies

public void moveArmies(Country source,
                       Country dest,
                       int armyCount)
                throws CountriesNotInRelationException,
                       NotEnoughArmiesException,
                       CountryOwnerException
Moves specific amount of armies from one to another, related country.

Parameters:
from - Country from where to move.
destination - Country to move to.
armyCount - Number of armies you want to move.
Throws:
CountriesNotInRelationException - Countries are not connected.
NotEnoughArmiesException - Not enough armies on the country to move.
CountryOwnerException

releaseCard

public void releaseCard(CountryCard countryCard)
Releases the desired card if the country is owned by the current player.

Parameters:
countryCard - Card to release.

Releases the the desired card series.

Parameters:
cardSeries -

cardStackReleaser

private void cardStackReleaser(java.util.Vector<CountryCard> releasableCards)
If there is a series available in the given card stack, it will be released. If there are two different series in the card stack only one will be released. Card stack must not be greater than 5 cards because a player should hold more.

Parameters:
releasableCards - Card stack to be released.
